info.name: Calendue
info.description: This is the specification for the Calendue API. Import the development environment to make requests to the localhost server.

item.name: New Account

exec: pm.test("Response is 'Email cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Email cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Username cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Username cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Password cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Password cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Email cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Email cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Username cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Username cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Password must be at least 5 characters'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Password must be at least 5 characters"));
pm.test("Response is 'Email is already taken'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Email is already taken"));

item.description:
Creates a new account.

Accepts `email`, `username`, and `password` params for the user.

Returns status code `201` upon success with the user ID as the response content.

Returns status code `400` upon validation failure with the error message as the content.

Validations are: 1) Email, Username, and Password cannot be blank, 2) Password must be >= 5 characters

item.name: Login

exec: pm.test("Content has flash message", () => pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.include("been logged out"));

item.description:
POST Request: Login accepts a `username` and `password` param.

Redirect with code 303 to `/` upon success.
Render failure with status code 401 if credentials are incorrect.

item.name: New Term

exec: pm.test("Response is 'Title cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Title cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Start Date cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Start Date cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'End Date cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("End Date cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Title cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Title cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Start Date cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Start Date cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'End Date cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("End Date cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'End Date cannot be before Start Date.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("End Date cannot be before Start Date."));

item.description:
POST Request: Creates a new term for the user. Accepts a `title` param, `start_date` param and `end_date` param.

Returns 201 upon success.
Returns 400 upon input validation.

item.name: New Course

exec: pm.test("Response is 'Title cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Title cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Title cannot be blank.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Title cannot be blank."));
pm.test("Response is 'Term ID is invalid.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Term ID is invalid."));
pm.test("Response is 'Term does not exist.'", () => pm.response.to.have.body("Term does not exist."));

item.description:
POST Request: Adds a new course to the user's schedule. Accepts the `title` param (the chosen title of the course), and `term_id` param which is the selected term for the user.

Returns 201 upon success.
Returns 400 if input fails validation (if `title` is blank, `term_id` is not found, or `token` is not found).

item.name: Get Calendar
item.description:
This retrives the calendar from the server. The server will return the calendar for the current user based on their session cookies. Accepts filter params as 'courses[0][uuid]=<course UUID>' to show course 0.

Returns a JSON representation of the calendar:

i.e.

`
{
	"<date>": [<assignment>],
	"2018-10-10": [{"name": 'Assignment 1', "uuid": <assignment UUID>}],
	...
}
`

item.name: Scrape
Get Assignment
item.description:
GET Request: Gets an Assignment based on its `assignment_id` param. Must ensure authorization and if not authorized, returns 401 status code.

Upon success, returns 200.

If assignment is not found, returns 404.

item.name: Mark Assignment Complete
item.description:
PUT Request: Marks the assignment as complete. Accepts `assignment_id` param for the assignment ID and a `time_spent` param for the time spent on the assignment.

Returns 404 if the assignment is not found or 200 if successful.

Returns 400 for validation error (if `time_spent` is blank)

item.name: Get Assignment Scores
